extracted_text: C. Density Standards. The maximum number of dwelling units permissible in the R-D Designed Residential District shall not exceed ninety percent (90%) of the number obtained by dividing the gross acreage by the minimum Lot size permitted in the pre-existing zone, and may be less where a determination is made by the Zoning Board that physical and topographical features of the land would preclude attainment of such density under prior existing zoning. (81-032; 203-04; 220-13)
llm_output.rationale: The extracted text provides the formula to calculate the maximum number of dwelling units permissible in the R-D Designed Residential District, which is related to the floor_to_area_ratio as it determines the density of the development.
llm_output.answer: 90% of the number obtained by dividing the gross acreage by the minimum Lot size permitted in the pre-existing zone
